meanings.definition: A short coat or outer garment worn by both men and women.
meanings.sent1: In winter, people wear jackets to stay warm.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new jacket for the upcoming trip.
meanings.sent3: The jacket was so big on him, it looked like a tent!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a jacket, wrapping everyone in warmth.
meanings.sent5: The red jacket stood out in the sea of black coats.

meanings.definition: A protective outer covering for a book or document.
meanings.sent1: The library uses jackets to protect old books.
meanings.sent2: He carefully placed the jacket on the rare manuscript.
meanings.sent3: The jacket slipped off the book and landed on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her words were a jacket shielding him from the harsh truth.
meanings.sent5: The jacket preserved the ancient text for generations to come.

meanings.definition: A metal casing for a bullet or shell.
meanings.sent1: The soldier loaded the bullet into the jacket.
meanings.sent2: The jacket of the shell was dented from the impact.
meanings.sent3: The jacket protected the bullet as it flew through the air.
meanings.sent4: His determination was the jacket around his heart, shielding him from fear.
meanings.sent5: The shiny jacket of the bullet gleamed in the sunlight.
